_header: One thousand year three hundred ninety and one
Note:
Occurs in texts of Wyntoun’s Chronicle, e.g., London, British Library Royal 17 D.XX, f. 276v (74 lines), pr. Laing (1872)
XLaing, David. The Orygynale Cronykil of Scotland. 3 vols. Edinburgh: Edmonston and Douglas, 1872-79, 3.56.
Subjects: The Duke of Orleans’ Defence of the Scots; Orleans, duke of; Scots, battle actions
_description: The Duke of Orleans’ Defence of the Scots, an extract from Wyntoun’s Chronicle (658), occurring separately — 64 lines in couplets.

CamMagPep2553.First Lines:
Ane thousand ȝeir thre hundret nyntye and anefra Iesus chryst
                    had manheid tane…
CamMagPep2553.Last Lines:
…And held þame still and spak na mairIn till dispyt as
                    þai did ayr
CamMagPep2553.Attributed Title:
ffinita responsio Illustrissimi ducis orlianensis in honorem et
                        defensionem scotie (p. 107)
